channel.title: If-Else :: Introduction to Python
channel.description: YouTube Video Resources Slides Python also supports another kind of conditional statement, the if-else statement. An if-else statement contains a single Boolean expression, but two blocks of code. If the Boolean expression evaluates to True, then one block of statements is executed. If it is False, then the other block will be executed. The general structure of an if-else statement in Python is shown below: if <boolean expression>: <block of statements 1> else: <block of statements 2> Notice that the else keyword is followed by a colon, just like the first line of the if-else statement.
